    • Method Detail

      • getTypeIdentifier

        public java.lang.String getTypeIdentifier()
        Description copied from interface: Configuration
        Returns a unique identifier for this configuration type. The identifier is used to determine factories and addons to construct and configure jobs, measurements, etc., given a corresponding configuration. Make sure that the ID returned is unique. The returned identifier should conform to "XXX.YYY", where XXX stands for an identifier of the organizational unit or the person who created the configuration (e.g. ETH, Smith, Cindarella), and YYY stands for an identifier of the specific kind of configuration (e.g. AutofocusJob, PlatePosition, MicroplateMeasurement). Optionally, additional hierarchy levels can be defined by additional separators ., e.g. "YouScope.AutofocusJob.Version1.1" The identifier should not contain spaces, non-ASCII characters, or colons (except for hierarchy level separation). Identifiers should start with a capital character, i.e. A-Z. Make sure to not use the same identifier for different configurations, since this might result in unexpected behavior or errors. Make
        Specified by:
        getTypeIdentifier in interface Configuration
        Returns:
        Unique identifier of the configuration type.

        Returns:

      • getImageSaveNames

        public java.lang.String[] getImageSaveNames()
        Description copied from interface: ImageProducerConfiguration
        Should return the names of all images produced by this job and which should be saved to disk. Allows to check YouScope if two jobs will later on try to save their images to the same file, thus erasing each other's result. Only names of images which are stored by YouScope's standard storage algorithm have to be returned.
        Specified by:
        getImageSaveNames in interface ImageProducerConfiguration
        Returns:
        Array of all image names produced by this job configuration, or null.

      • getNumberOfImages

        public int getNumberOfImages()
        Description copied from interface: ImageProducerConfiguration
        Returns the number of images which get produced per evaluation of a job initialized with this configuration. Typically, this is one. However, some jobs can produce more than one image, and the number of the produced images may or may not depend on the configuration. Some jobs might even produce no images at all for certain configurations (but usually for other configurations they produce images, otherwise this interface would not make sense to implement).
        Specified by:
        getNumberOfImages in interface ImageProducerConfiguration
        Returns:
        Number of produced images. Zero indicate that no images are produced by this job type at all. Negative numbers indicate that the number of images is not known, or that it might even vary.

      • isBurstImaging

        public boolean isBurstImaging()
        Returns if the imaging is done in burst mode. This corresponds to that the job queries for all images in the image buffer, not only for the newest one, every time it is executed.
        Returns:
        True if in burst mode, false otherwise.

      • setBurstImaging

        public void setBurstImaging(boolean burstImaging)
        Sets if the images are produced in burst mode. This corresponds to that the job queries for all images in the image buffer, not only for the newest one, every time it is executed. Default is false.
        Parameters:
        burstImaging - True if burst imaging should be activated, false if not.
